Description: Body sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; part of lotus bud in added white outline with added red centre; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior (Williams 1983, 169) and many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim; several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. The number 36 is written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 168, no. 135a)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 726, no. 861)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1748) (phase 2)
